Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the map by suggesting that it proves wildfires stop at the US-Canada border.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the absence of wildfires north or south of the US border is evidence that climate change is not the cause.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that wildfires stopping at the US-Canada border is proof that climate change is not responsible.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Canada also experiences wildfires, although the frequency and severity may vary.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the possibility that differences in firefighting strategies, land management practices, or climate patterns may contribute to the discrepancy in wildfire occurrence between the US and Canada.
